item.description: Open Source dependencies in software projects Most of the foundations of current commercial software projects are open source. But what happens when an open source project becomens unmaintained? Dependencies, dependencies everywhere! Most software projects have a miriad of depedendencies. Why? Because we (as software engineers) are not going to reinvent the wheel. Having your software depend on a well-tested, maintained, and supported is a bliss. item.title: The value of open source software
item.author: diegojromerolopez@gmail.com (Diego J. Romero-L贸pez)
item.description: I have some open source projects in my github account. Some of them are currently used by my ex-employer in several projects. Why should an organization have to open source some of its software? Let’s talk about it. Dissipating some doubts about software quality Having published your code in public allow many users to take a look to your code and (if it’s good) to dissipate its doubts about if it pays using it or not.
